column4: Hi, I recently updated jaunty, and have been since unable to use my Broadcom wireless card.... here is the launchpad bug related to the same problem. But I am not able to implement the solution. Please help
Looks like that bug is resolved, you just have to update your repo and then upgrade
I tried that, and it installed the broken packages
Then your mirror is out of date
Open up System->Administration->Software Sources and switch to the main server
The bug is resolved, you must not be updating before upgrading
What program are you using to upgrade?
I'm trying reinstalling the linux-headers-2.6.28-12 files
sudo aptitude update && sudo aptitude dist-upgrade
The bug was linux-restricted-modules-2.6.28-12-generic did not exist, it now exists
The bug you linked to is fixed
I understand that completely, just that my broadcom doesnt seem to be in the mood to recover
that's because l-r-m only builds the kernel modules on boot
